topics.body:
So apparently the supreme court ruled in favor of "obamacare" 6-3.



Also the original creator of Deus Ex called VR a fad and talked about how companies are putting too much money into it.

I may like VR, but I actually somewhat agree on this.  Right now VR headsets are too expensive for the financial payoff to be worth it and we're still a couple years from widespread adoption.  What I mean by this is that facebook dumped $2 billion into oculus; they're never going to get their money back cause A)everyone is making their own VR helmets B)it's still a couple years till widespread adoption and C)VR is too expensive currently for wide spread adoption.

In the long run I think it will be popular, but they're thinking it will instantly be worth hundreds of billions of dollars.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558c4a0a6368726a1500064a#post_558c4a0a6368726a1500064a
It's totally a fad. But it will probably be a lasting one when they FINNALY perfect it.

But the whole making like millions upon millions, it probably won't happen if you ask me. If anything it could become like kinect, great in theory, terrible when forced on you.


*still wishes to play HL2 in oculus anyway*
topics.author: 500757fd7f123b75a90003b1

topics.body:
And in other news students in the UK have created condoms that turn specifically different colors if you have a std.

On the one hand this could just outright stone cold stop stds from spreading, but that would be very awkward.

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/558c4b086368724e1f000260#post_558c4b086368724e1f000260
You can already play Half-Life 2 with Oculus.


The problem with it currently is that the VR headsets are worth around $300 currently; personally I think it will only become widespread once the price comes down below the $100 mark.  If it hits the $100 mark then you can market it to gamers, but $300?  Are you fucking mad?
